request.description:
http://localhost:9200/cf_etf/_search?q=fund_name:ishares edge global&default_operator=AND

	The query is to restrict the returned documents where the field, fund_name , must contain all three wordsâ€” iShares , Edge , and Global .

search across 2 indices

should return something more than 314
"value": 318,
should return 314

POST http://localhost:9200/cf_etf/_search?from=2&size=2&sort=symbol:asc&_source=false

from=2 parameter to control the starting item index to 2

size=2 parameter to control the number of items returned to 2

sort=symbol:asc parameter to sort the symbol field in ascending order.

_source=false parameter to disable the return of the _source field
keyword analyzer will not retuen anything
to obtain ishares edge msci series commission free ETFs . The result needs to be sorted with the rating field first, followed by the symbol field

scrolling is executed three times to consume all documents. We will set the size to 313 and specify 10 minutes for the live time period

Will need to run the 2nd scroll request with the scroll_id
2nd part of the scroll request
this should be empty

Run this to free up resources

needs the last scroll_id

calculate the final score from the original score and rescore

The query is to find the description field with the words emerging, non-diversified, high-yield, global, or 
dividend.
The first hit is the EDIV symbol with _score=4.9638467 :

rescore the resulting documents with a higher weight if the description field contains a global word. We set the weight for the original request to 0.1, and the rescore request to 0.9. The first hit is the DEW symbol with
score=2.7334738

same resxorce but with score_mode:avg

The first hit will be the DGRE symbol with _score=2.7893128

finding the description field containing the keyword Asia,
USA, or Europe. However, we want to report matching keywords in the hit. We can issue a bool query with a should clause, where each query is named for a region
using the default operator, or , to find the ETFs with the fund_name field that contains either one, ishares or global word.
use the operator parameter with the and option to find the ETFs with the fund_name field that contains both words

fuzziness=2 (this permits two edits to the token). 
returns 5 hits, 

in the fuzzy matching the word global can be changed to local with two edits

using match_phrase to retrieve all iShares msci ETFs.

18 ETFs have a name with that phrase.

The first criterion is that the ETFs fund_name field
must have the text MSCI Markets , with a gap of at most one word between.

The second criterion is that the ETFs fund_name field must have the text ETF, and it must appear after MSCI Markets. The total number of hits is 4 ETFs:

item.name: compund_queries
item.description: Compound queries are used to combine multiple clauses to build a complex query
